title: Sketch Class: Sketching Stories
short_description: Take a cue from visual storytellers in the Art Institute’s collection, such as the 17th-century Dutch masters. In this course you’ll mine diverse artwork for ideas and inspiration as you use sketching to construct your own artistic narratives. A multi-session sketch class over six weeks
description:
Six Saturdays 
July 27–August 31 
10:45 a.m.–12:45 p.m.

This program is for people ages 16 and up. All materials will be provided. 

Take a cue from visual storytellers in the Art Institute’s collection, such as the 17th-century Dutch masters. In this course you’ll mine diverse artwork for ideas and inspiration as you use sketching to construct your own artistic narratives.

About the Instructor
Mark Krisco is an art history lecturer and sketch instructor with over 25 years of experience at the Art Institute. In addition to lecturing at SAIC and the Oxford Round Table, he has served as curator for the Dr. Martin and Francey Gecht Collection, the Marshall Field’s Archives, and the Pope John Paul II Newman Center in Washington, DC.

See all upcoming sketch classes and workshops. For additional information, please call (312) 443-3680 or email museum-programs@artic.edu. 

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
